items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the individuals responsible for the multiple armed robberies that occurred between November 28, 2019 and January 7, 2020.
items.description:
November 2019 to January 2020
Fitchburg, Wisconsin; Town of Blooming Grove, Wisconsin; Madison, Wisconsin

images.caption: BP Gas Station, Fitchburg, Wisconsin, November 28, 2019
Capitol Petro Mart, Fitchburg, Wisconsin, December 21, 2019
Magnuson Grand Hotel, Town of Blooming Grove, Wisconsin, December 27, 2019

items.details:
Two unknown suspects have committed multiple armed robberies in Wisconsin between November 28, 2019, and January 7, 2020. The suspects were armed with semi-automatic handguns. In each robbery, they approached the victim clerk, handed them a black bag and demanded money. After the victim clerk complied with their demands, the suspects left the businesses:

 

BP Gas Station

2932 Fish Hatchery Road, Fitchburg, Wisconsin

November 28, 2019

 

Capitol Petro Mart

2770 S. Syene Road, Fitchburg, Wisconsin

December 21, 2019

 

Magnuson Grand Hotel

3510 Millpond Road, Town of Blooming Grove

December 27, 2019

 

7-Eleven Gas Station

2216 University Avenue, Madison, Wisconsin

January 7, 2020

 

Both suspects are described as black males between the ages of 18 and 25. They are approximately 5’10” to 6’0" tall and weigh between 150 to 180 pounds.

In all of the robberies, Suspect 1 wore all black clothing, white tennis shoes, white/gray nitrile coated gloves, and a half white and half black full facemask.  Suspect 2 wore all black clothing, black tennis shoes, blue/gray nitrile coated gloves, and a white or black balaclava style mask.
items.title: MULTIPLE ARMED ROBBERIES - Wisconsin

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information leading to the identification, location, arrest, and conviction of those involved in this attempted armed robbery and shooting.
items.details:
The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and the Bensalem Police Department in Bensalem, Pennsylvania, are seeking information from the public about an attempted armed robbery and shooting.  

 

On March 20, 2020, just before 9 p.m., an unknown male subject, armed with a black revolver, entered First Stop Cigarettes & Cigars, located at 919 Bristol Pike in Bensalem, Pennsylvania.  The subject pointed the handgun at a male employee behind the counter and demanded money.  Soon thereafter, the subject fired a single gunshot, striking the employee in the chest.  The subject then fled the store on foot, meeting up outside with a second unknown male acting as a lookout. The two subjects were last seen heading into the parking area of the Grandview Gardens apartment complex, adjacent to the cigarette shop.  The employee was transported to the hospital in critical condition with life-threatening injuries.

 

The armed subject is described as a Black male, approximately 6'0" tall, wearing a gray sweatshirt, black pants, black shoes, and a white mask over his nose and mouth.

 

The second subject, the lookout, is described as a Black male wearing a light-colored shirt, dark-colored pants, and white sneakers.
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED ARMED AND DANGEROUS
items.title: ATTEMPTED ARMED ROBBERY AND SHOOTING

items.description:
Springfield Art Museum
Springfield, Missouri
April 7, 2016
items.details: The FBI is seeking information leading to the recovery of artwork stolen from the Springfield Art Museum in Springfield, Missouri. It is believed the theft occurred sometime during the early morning hours on April 7, 2016, at which time 7 of the 10 Andy Warhol prints on permanent display at the museum were taken. The collection, which has been owned by the Springfield Art Museum since 1985, is Set Number 31 of the Campbell's Soup I collection and is valued at approximately $500,000. Each print in the screen print collection measures 37 inches high by 24.5 inches wide and are framed in white frames. Images of the stolen artwork are featured above.
items.title: STOLEN ANDY WARHOL PRINTS

items.caution:
Leslie Delbecq and her mother, Jeanine De Riddere, are wanted for their alleged involvement in the kidnapping of Leslie Delbecq's daughter, Gabrielle Dahm, from Broward County, Florida, in 2010. Leslie Delbecq is the ex-wife of Christopher Dahm, Gabrielle's biological father. In January 2010, during a court hearing in Florida, Delbecq and Dahm were awarded joint custody of Gabrielle.

 

However, it is alleged that Leslie Delbecq and Jeanine De Riddere arranged for Gabrielle to be taken from Florida on August 2, 2010, and arrive in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates, on August 4, 2010. All of their tickets to Abu Dhabi allegedly were purchased through an airline employee. On August 4, 2010, Leslie Delbecq failed to return Gabrielle to her father, Christopher Dahm, as stated in the Broward County Court order. Gabrielle is believed to have been moved to Abu Dhabi in violation of the court order that denied Leslie Delbecq's request to relocate to Abu Dhabi with Gabrielle, and stated that Gabrielle is to remain in the United States.

 

On June 21, 2011, Leslie Delbecq and Jeanine De Riddere were indicted for international parental kidnapping by a Federal Grand Jury for the United States District Court, Southern District of Florida. Federal warrants were issued for their arrests.
items.title: JEANINE DE RIDDERE
items.remarks: Jeanine De Riddere speaks English and may speak other languages. She has dual citizenship in Belgium and the Democratic Republic of Congo. She may travel to Dubai, United Arab Emirates and Belgium.

items.title: LESLIE DELBECQ
items.hair_raw: Sandy blonde (may be dyed or highlighted)
items.remarks: Leslie Delbecq has citizenship in the United States and Belgium. She may travel to Belgium and Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $200,000 for information leading directly to the arrest of Jason Derek Brown.
items.description: Unlawful Flight to Avoid Prosecution - First Degree Murder, Armed Robbery
items.caution: Jason Derek Brown is wanted for murder and armed robbery in Phoenix, Arizona. During November of 2004, Brown allegedly shot and killed an armored car guard outside a movie theater and then fled with the money.
items.remarks:
Brown speaks fluent French and has a master's degree in International Business. He is an avid golfer, snowboarder, skier, and dirt biker. Brown enjoys being the center of attention and has been known to frequent nightclubs where he enjoys showing off his high-priced vehicles, boats, and other toys. Brown was a member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, and completed his Mormon mission near Paris, France.

 

Brown has ties to California, Arizona, and Utah. In the past, he has traveled to France and Mexico. Additionally, he may be in the possession of a Glock 9mm and a .45 caliber handgun.
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED ARMED AND EXTREMELY DANGEROUS
items.title: JASON DEREK BROWN

items.remarks: Markowski was last seen wearing a green shirt, blue jeans, and black shoes. At the time of her disappearance, she was missing her baby molars.
items.details: Bethany Markowski, then 11 years old, was last seen by her father in the parking lot of the Old Hickory Shopping Mall in Jackson, Tennessee, on the afternoon of March 4, 2001. Bethany had gone into the mall alone while her father waited for her in the car. After approximately two hours passed, Bethany's father went into the mall to look for his daughter, but was unable to locate her. Investigative efforts have revealed that Bethany was last seen after a trip to Little Rock, Arkansas.
items.title: BETHANY LEANNE MARKOWSKI

items.details:
On Sunday, June 17, 2012, at approximately 2200 hours, a female was sexually assaulted on the shoulder of South Foothills Hwy (Hwy 93), just south of Boulder city limits. The victim was lost and had stopped on the highway shoulder to update her GPS. The offender approached her driver’s side window and asked if she was okay. He then ordered her out of the vehicle and displayed a handgun, possibly a small compact, black, semi-automatic. The suspect ordered the victim to the backseat of his vehicle, described as a late model Jeep Cherokee, or similar, gray or blue in color with cloth fabric. The victim was sexually assaulted in the backseat of the suspect’s vehicle. After the assault, the victim was ordered out of the car and left at the side of the road. The suspect was last seen making a U-turn and driving back towards Boulder.

The victim did not recall seeing the suspect’s vehicle on the shoulder when she first stopped and did not see the suspect’s vehicle pull up behind her. The description of the suspect is vague, and it is believed he was a white male, approximately 5’11” in height.

After further interviews with the victim, she was able to provide additional details about the offender: a white male with longer; bondish arm hair. He had rough hands similar to a person who works with his hands. She described a tattoo on his upper left arm, possibly green in color, circle shape. She was only able to see the lower portion of the tattoo, due to a short-sleeve shirt covering the rest of the tattoo.
items.title: UNKNOWN SUSPECT - BOULDER COUNTY, COLORADO

items.details: On May 20, 2019, Maricopa County Sheriff's Office detectives recovered the skeletal remains of an unidentified male in the outlying area of Wickenburg, Arizona. Several buttons and a manufacturer's tag located with the body showed the victim was potentially wearing a military-style jacket. Other evidence collected at the scene determined the decedent died by manner of homicide. The medical examiner provided a time of death ranging from five to 25 years, and a forensic composite sketch was provided to depict the speculated appearance of the decedent.
items.title: JOHN DOE - WICKENBURG, ARIZONA

items.details: Christine Marie Eastin went missing from Hayward, California, on January 18, 1971.  She left her home at 10:00 p.m. to go to the car wash and then pick up her friend at the local Jack in the Box restaurant.  She never arrived to pick up her friend.  The vehicle she drove was found at a car wash located at 25400 Mission Boulevard in Hayward.  Her purse was locked inside the vehicle.   Christine was last seen wearing a black/brown leather coat, black boots, blue slacks, a red, white, and blue pinstriped tunic, and a bluish gold scarf.
items.weight: 130 pounds (at the time of her disappearance)
items.title: CHRISTINE MARIE EASTIN

items.remarks: The unidentified John Doe wore white socks, black jeans, a black leather belt with a metal clasp, and a red, white, and burgundy t-shirt. He also had a small triple razor blade.
items.details: On May 2, 2002, an unidentified John Doe was located in a desert area of Apache Junction, Arizona. The victim's first name could possibly be "Frank" or "Francisco," and he may have been a transient that lived in Apache Junction, Arizona. The victim had four tattoos: a woman with a hat on his left shoulder; a woman with a bird on his right shoulder; a star, asterisk, or marijuana plant on his right hand; and a stylistic symbol or letter F on his left hand.
items.title: JOHN DOE - APACHE JUNCTION, ARIZONA

items.remarks: Melendez may have fled to Jalisco, Mexico.
items.title: ADRIANNA MELENDEZ
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information directly leading to the location, arrest, and conviction of Adrianna Melendez.
items.caution: Adrianna Melendez is wanted for her alleged involvement in an accident which caused the death of a bicyclist.  On the afternoon of March 26, 2014, a bicyclist riding on a country road in an unincorporated part of Solano County, California, (near Winters, California) was struck and killed by a vehicle.  The driver of the vehicle fled the scene prior to the arrival of law enforcement.  After a law enforcement investigation identified Melendez as the driver of the vehicle, a warrant was issued for her arrest by the Superior Court of Solano County, California, on May 14, 2014, and she was charged with vehicular homicide and hit and run.  A federal arrest warrant was issued for Melendez on April 11, 2017, in the United States District Court, Eastern District of California, Sacramento, California, after she was charged with unlawful flight to avoid prosecution.
items.description: Unlawful Flight to Avoid Prosecution - Vehicular Manslaughter, Hit and Run

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the individuals responsible.  Additional reward money may be available.
items.details:
On March 6, 2020, multiple victims, including a 5-year-old boy, were shot inside Snap's Barbershop, located at 6219 Dix Street NE, in Washington, D.C.  At approximately 6 p.m., three unknown males entered the shop and opened fire on those inside.  The three men then left the barbershop and fled the scene in a silver minivan which has since been recovered.  The FBI is assisting the Washington DC Metropolitan Police Department in this investigation.

 

Two of the men were wearing dark clothing with hooded jackets/sweatshirts.  The third man was wearing jeans, a dark jacket with a hood, and red sneakers.
items.title: MULTIPLE VICTIM SHOOTING

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $25,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the Rey Omar Pagan-Hernandez.
items.description: Attempted Carjacking, Stealing A Firearm, Brandishing a Firearm in Relation to a Crime of Violence, Aiding and Abetting
items.caution: Rey Omar Pagan-Hernandez is wanted for his alleged involvement in an armed robbery and attempted car jacking. On November 23, 2019 at 10:00 pm, three males riding in a black 1996-2006 Mercedes E320 vehicle approached an FBI Special Agent on the corner of Cacique Street and Las Americas Avenue, in the Ocean Park community of San Juan, Puerto Rico. The FBI Special Agent was held at gunpoint and the three men made away with his wallet, FBI credentials and official duty weapon. On December 13, 2019, a federal arrest warrant was issued for Pagan-Hernandez in the United States District Court for the District of Puerto Rico after he was charged with attempted carjacking, stealing a firearm, brandishing a firearm during and in relation to a crime of violence and aiding and abetting.
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED ARMED AND DANGEROUS
items.title: REY OMAR PAGAN-HERNANDEZ

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $25,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of Jomar Apellaniz-Sainz.
items.description: Attempted Carjacking, Stealing a Firearm, Brandishing a Weapon During and in Relation to a Crime of Violence, Aiding and Abetting
items.caution: Jomar Apellaniz-Sainz is wanted for his alleged involvement in an armed robbery and attempted car jacking. On November 23, 2019 at 10:00 pm, three males riding in a black 1996-2006 Mercedes E320 vehicle approached an FBI Special Agent on the corner of Cacique Street and Las Americas Ave., in the Ocean Park community of San Juan, Puerto Rico. The FBI Special Agent was held at gunpoint and the three men made away with his wallet, FBI credentials and official duty weapon. On December 13, 2019, a federal arrest warrant was issued for Apellaniz-Sainz in the United States District Court for the District of Puerto Rico after he was charged with attempted carjacking, stealing a firearm, brandishing a firearm during and in relation to a crime of violence and aiding and abetting.
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED ARMED AND DANGEROUS
items.title: JOMAR APELLANIZ-SAINZ

items.description: Kidnapping; Hobbs Act Robbery; Carjacking; Possession and Brandishing of Firearms in Furtherance of a Crime of Violence (two counts)
items.caution: Angel Medina-Santos is wanted for his alleged involvement in multiple armed robberies. Medina-Santos is allegedly a violent gang member from Las Lisas, Vega Baja, with ties to Morovis, Puerto Rico. On October 21, 2019, a federal arrest warrant was issued for Medina-Santos in the United States District Court for the District of Puerto Rico, after he was charged with kidnapping; Hobbs Act robbery; carjacking; and possession and brandishing of firearms in furtherance of a crime of violence (two counts).
items.scars_and_marks: Medina-Santos has a tattoo of a face/head on the inside of his right forearm. He may also have a sleeve tattoo on his left arm.
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED ARMED AND DANGEROUS
items.title: ANGEL MEDINA-SANTOS

items.details:
On September 12, 1980, a 32-year-old male and his 22-year-old female companion traveled from their home state of Missouri to Iowa for a weekend getaway. They checked into the Amana Holiday Inn (along Interstate 80, just outside of Williamsburg) that evening and were found deceased the following afternoon by the motel maid. The victims had been stabbed to death, possibly with an axe or hatchet that had a 3 ½ inch blade. The male victim had seven stab wounds to his arms, hands, face, head, and neck/throat (including possible defensive wounds to his hands). The female victim had twelve stab wounds to her face, head, and neck/throat. There were no signs of forced entry into the motel room and no obvious signs of sexual assault. The victims were in bed, face-down, partly under the covers. The male victim was wearing only his underwear and the female victim was fully clothed. The victims’ personal belongings were scattered and approximately $200 was taken. Small pieces of a bar of bath soap were on the floor next to the bed. The word "this" was printed on the bathroom door, possibly using the bar of soap, and toothpaste was squeezed into the bathtub. Investigators have identified two cases with similarities to the instant case: the homicide of a 25-year-old male in Galesburg, Illinois, on June 24,1980 and the homicide of a 23-year-old male in Meridian, Mississippi on October 26, 1970. Like the instant case, the Galesburg and Meridian victims were away from home and staying in a motel room just off a busy Interstate. Additionally, in all three cases, toothpaste was found in an unusual location at the crime scene, the weapon used is believed to be a machete or sort of axe/hatchet, and money was taken. 

If you have information relevant to this investigation, or know of other cases that resemble the details of this homicide (e.g., victim(s) was killed in a motel room near a busy interstate; weapon used was an axe, hatchet, or machete; toothpaste or soap was found in an unusual location at the crime scene; writing or drawings were left at the crime scene), please contact the agency below.  

<p>To provide or request additional information, please contact: Captain Todd Sauerbrei, Iowa County Sheriff’s Office, Iowa, (319) 642-7307, TSauerbrei@iowacosheriff.org - - FBI ViCAP, (800) 634-4097, vicap@fbi.gov
items.title: UNKNOWN SUSPECT(S) - UNSOLVED HOMICIDES - IOWA

items.details:
The FBI's Northern Virginia Violent Crime Taskforce and the Loudoun County Sherriff's Office are investigating two robberies of food markets in Sterling, Virginia, in February of 2020. 

 

The first robbery occurred at 3:48 a.m., on February 7, 2020, at the 7-Eleven located on 23131 Rock Hill Road, Sterling, Virginia.  The suspect jumped over the counter of the store and stole goods.  He was wearing a gray raincoat with a blue hoodie underneath, black sweatpants, white sneakers, a black mask, one black glove, and one white glove.  The suspect entered the parking lot in a older model (late 90s) burgundy Honda Civic.

 

The second robbery occurred at 12:58 p.m., on February 10, 2020, at the High Up Food Mart located at 428 Enterprise Street, Sterling, Virginia.  In this robbery, the same suspect took cash from the register of the store.  He was wearing a black mask, black sunglasses, a dark gray hooded jacket, gray sweatpants and black sneakers with white soles.  The suspect presented a handgun.
items.title: ARMED FOOD MARKET ROBBERIES
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $5,000 for information about these crimes.
items.description:
Unknown Suspect
Sterling, Virginia
February of 2020

items.details:
The FBI's Washington Field Office and Northern Virginia Violent Crime Taskforce are assisting the Loudoun County Sheriff's Office with the investigation into a robbery that took place at 6:45 p.m., on February 11, 2020, at the Everfield Community Park, next to the intersection of Everfield Drive and Lavender Valley Court, in Ashburn, Virginia.  Suspect #1 approached a vehicle and requested jumper cables.  He then brandished a firearm and struck the victim driver of the car with his hand.  Suspect #2 entered the passenger side of the victim's vehicle and stole electronics and a case from the car.  Both suspects then ran to a nearby vehicle, described as a dark-colored sedan, driven by another individual.  They all fled the scene traveling towards Route 50.

 

Suspect #1 is described as a Hispanic male, 5'10", wearing a dark hoodie and gloves.

 

Suspect #2 is described as a Hispanic male, approximately 20 years of age, wearing a red jacket and gloves.
items.title: ARMED ROBBERY

items.details:
On August 1, 2019, at approximately 10:00 a.m., a GardaWorld armored car was attacked at gunpoint at 3535 Market Street in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania’s University City section.


 
Two armed robbers and a getaway driver were observed.  Armed Robber 1 was in possession of a semi-automatic rifle loaded with a drum-style magazine and Armed Robber 2 was in possession of a loaded semi-automatic handgun.


 
Video from surveillance cameras in the area of the attempted robbery shows the subjects arriving on the scene in their vehicle, two armed robbers advancing towards the armored car, and then fleeing upon encountering gunfire from the armored car personnel.  Armed Robber 1 is seen diving into the vehicle, with the driver taking off, and Armed Robber 2 then fleeing on foot.


 
Armed Robber 2 has been arrested and charged with attempted robbery which interferes with interstate commerce in connection with this incident.  He is in federal custody.  The FBI seeks information about the remaining individuals.
items.title: ATTEMPTED ARMORED CAR ROBBERY
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $25,000 for information leading to the identification, arrest, and conviction of the remaining individuals responsible for the attempted armored car robbery.
